Suspicious processes modifying executabl.Action: Monitor host file system events and process activity for modifications to executable files in system or application directories. Use correlation analysis to link binary modifications to suspicious processes or user accounts. Flag modifications not coinciding with scheduled software updates.

Executable binaries exhibiting invalid o.Action: Regularly calculate checksums or verify digital signatures for critical system and application binaries. Compare current checksums/signatures against known good values. Flag binaries with invalid or missing signatures. Use time series analysis to identify unusual frequency or timing of signature invalidation events.

Execution of critical system or applicat.Data: Host Process Execution Logs, Zeek conn.log
Execution of critical system or applicat.Action: Monitor process execution logs for execution of binaries identified with invalid signatures or recent modifications. Analyze execution patterns, including parent-child process relationships and command-line arguments. Correlate execution events with subsequent network connections observed in Zeek conn.log.

Processes loading unexpected dynamic lib.Data: Host Process Module Load Logs, Host Process Execution Logs
Processes loading unexpected dynamic lib.Action: Monitor process events for dynamic library loading (e.g., dylib loading on macOS). Identify loaded libraries originating from non-standard system paths (e.g., user directories, temporary folders). Use frequency analysis to identify rare or previously unseen dylibs being loaded by legitimate processes.
